p: ‘Lemon oil’ is described in a monograph of the European Pharmacopoeia 10.0 (PhEur, 2020). It is defined as the essential oil obtained by a suitable mechanical procedure without heating from the fresh peel of Citrus limon (L.) Burm. f. (currently accepted name: C. limon (L.) Osbeck). As identity‐test the monograph describes thin‐layer chromatography for detection of citral and several furocoumarins, namely bergamottin, 5‐geranyloxy‐7‐methoxycoumarin, citropten, a psoralen derivative and biakangelicin.
